info.name: FA Integration
info.description:
## Disclaimer

This is not the official commercetools Composable Commerce documentation. Please see [here](http://docs.commercetools.com/)  
for a complete and approved documentation of the commercetools Composable Commerce.

## How to use

**:warning: Be aware that postman automatically synchronizes environment variables (including your API client credentials) to your workspace if logged in.  
Use this collection only for development purposes and non-production projects.**

To use this collection in Postman please perform the following steps:

1. Download and install the Postman Client
2. Import the [collection.json](collection.json) and [template.json](template.json) in your postman application
3. In the Merchant Center, create a new API Client and fill in the client credentials in your environment
4. Obtain an access token by sending the "Authorization/Obtain access token" request at the bottom of the request list. Now you can use all other endpoints
    

Feel free to clone and modify this collection to your needs.

To automate frequent tasks the collection automatically manages commonly required values and parameters such  
as resource ids, keys and versions in Postman environment variables for you.

Please see [http://docs.commercetools.com/](http://docs.commercetools.com/) for further information about the commercetools Plattform.

item.name: Case 01 - Warehouse shipping
Create custom types for Channel and Cart/Order
[Backend] Add preferred delivery field to cart/order
Create API Extension
item.description:
The Extension triggers an AWS Lambda function which checks if there is a value for the deliveryChannel on cart. If so it returns an array of update actions to set that channel as the supplyChannel for all line items in the cart.

The arn, accessKey, accessSecret should be provided by the instructor.

The expression should only be triggered if preferredDeliveryType on cart has a value different to "none".

item.name: [BFF] Create new Cart & add to cart

item.description:
Merchant High-tech would like to migrate to Composable Commerce and to do this they need to set up the Shipping Methods as a POC. Our POC should be concerned about the functional requirements, API flows needed to build the experience but not develop the UI.

- Merchant High-tech has one warehouse that fulfills online customer orders for Australia.
- The warehouse will support:
    - standard delivery (cost $5 AUD, free above $50 AUD)
    - express delivery (cost $10 AUD, free above $100 AUD)
- Shipping codes that should be passed to the ERP for the order:
    - Standard warehouse delivery = warehouseStandard
    - Express warehouse delivery = warehouseExpress
- The presentation layer should show the following lead times for each Shipping Method
    - Standard warehouse delivery = 3 - 5 business days
    - Express warehouse delivery = 1 - 2 business days

item.name: Case 02 - Retail store click & collect
[Backend] Add Time Zone field to Channel
Add and set customerLocalTime to cart
Add store collect shipping methods
item.description:
Create a shipping method:

- Click and collect same day
    - Key: inStoreSameDay
    - Description: Available same day after 30 minutes
    - Predicate: Cart custom field deliveryType = retailClick&Collect AND cart localTime is between 01:00 AM - 03:30 PM
    - Zone: Australia
    - Rate $0 AUD

- Click and collect next day
    - Key: inStoreNextDay
    - Description: Available tomorrow
    - Predicate: Cart custom field deliveryType = retailClick&Collect AND cart localTime is not between 01:00 AM - 03:30 PM
    - Zone: Australia
    - Rate $0 AUD

item.name: [BFF] Get stores within 20km range of customer

url.raw: {{host}}/{{project-key}}/channels?limit=5&where=geoLocation within circle(115.9213, -32.0777, 20000) and custom(fields(deliveryType contains any ("retailClickAndCollect")))

query.value: geoLocation within circle(115.9213, -32.0777, 20000) and custom(fields(deliveryType contains any ("retailClickAndCollect")))

item.description:
High-tech has 80 retail stores, each with their own inventory level. A customer should be able to order online and pick up (Click & Collect/ BOPIS) from a store if the items are instock for the cart.

- All click and collect orders will be ready for pick-up on the same day when the order is made between 01:00 AM - 3:30 PM. All orders made after this time should clearly communicate that they will be ready next business day.
- Cost: Free
- Shipping codes that should be passed to the ERP for the order:
    - Click and collect same day = inStoreSameDay
    - Click and collect business day = inStoreNextDay

The customer experience should follow:

1. Cart has items and customer is on the checkout page
2. Customer can see delivery options: Delivery and Click & Collect
3. Customer selects Click & Collect
4. System: displays a postcode / suburb input
5. Customer inputs values
    1. System: sends values to address validator service with valid suggestions returned
    2. System: displays valid suggestions in UI
    3. Customer selects one if the valid options
    4. System: takes selected option, gets its geocode and finds the closest 5 retail stores within 20 KM radius. Checks the stock for each matching retail store
6. System: displays matching retail stores sorted by distance to the customer (no more than 5 stores should be displayed). As Well as displaying which retails stores have enough stock
7. Customer: selects one retail store that has stock
8. System: Assigns selected retail store for click & collect
9. Shipping step completed. Customer can more to next checkout step
10. FLOW ENDED
    

All Click & Collect orders must be ready for pick up within 30 minutes of order creation. How can we support this?

item.name: Create cart and add items to it
[BFF] Customer selects same day delivery as shipping method
[BFF] Get stores within 15km range of customer

url.raw: {{host}}/{{project-key}}/channels?where=geoLocation within circle(115.9213, -32.0777, 15000) and custom(fields(deliveryType contains any ("courierAsap")))&limit=1

query.value: geoLocation within circle(115.9213, -32.0777, 15000) and custom(fields(deliveryType contains any ("courierAsap")))
